org.simplug.framework.core.pluginmanagement
Class PluginManager

java.lang.Object
  org.simplug.framework.core.pluginmanagement.PluginManager

public class PluginManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for managing all plugins deployed with the SimPlug Framework.
It manages all incoming events and delegates them to the receiving plugins. It functions as kind of "uber-manager" for all the other managers like EventQueueManager or similar.

          Simple constructor initializing all needed members.

Constructor Detail

PluginManager

public PluginManager()
Simple constructor initializing all needed members. It does NOT load or start any plugins.

Method Detail

loadAndRegisterPlugins

public void loadAndRegisterPlugins()
This method is responsible for loading all plugins and registering them for later access. It reads the SimPlug configuration and uses a PluginLoader to load all the plugins and save them in a specific structure.
This method only loads and registers the plugins. It neither initializes them nor starts them in any way.

manageEvent

public void manageEvent(Event event)
Whenever an event is fired it has to be managed by this method. Therefore the plugin manager manages an event queue. This thread safe structure is filled with every event and the EventQueueManager is responsible for executing those events. When no EventQueueManager is instantiated the plugin manager instantiates one.

Parameters:
event - the event which was fired and now has to be managed.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
This method shuts down the EventQueueManager. By doing so all pending events get discarded. Only use this method if that is the wanted behaviour or if the shutdown is safe (check using isSafeShutdown()).

isSafeShutdown

public boolean isSafeShutdown()
When there are no events in the queue left it is safe to shutdown. Otherwise it is not.

Returns:
true if it is safe to shut down or false otherwise.

logPlugins

@Deprecated
public void logPlugins()
Deprecated. 

SimPlug.logLoadedPlugins()
